intro: Wittmackia caymanensis, commonly known as the Cayman Islands bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the Cayman Islands. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its showy, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows in coastal areas and thrives in well-drained, sandy soils. It is a herbaceous perennial that produces clusters of small, fragrant blooms during the summer months. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
